{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Tiki Taane | image = | caption = | background = solo_singer | birth_name = | alias = | born = {{Birth date and age|1976|12|17|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Christchurch]], New Zealand | death_date = | origin = | instrument = [[Guitar]], [[percussion]], [[Keyboard instrument|keys]], [[drums]], [[Sampler (musical instrument)|samples]], [[Taonga Puoro]], [[Dubbing (music)|King Of The Dubs]] | genre = [[dub music|Dub]]
[[Drum and bass]]
[[Electronica]]
[[Acoustic m usic|Acoustic]]
[[Dubstep]] | occupation = Musician, Producer, | years_active = 1991–present | label = Dirty Dub | Notable_albums = "[[Past, Present, Future (Tiki Taane album)|Past, Present, Future]]" | Notable_songs = "[[Always On My Mind (Tiki Taane song)|Always On My Mind]]" | associated_acts = [[Salmonella Dub]] | website = [http://tikidub.com/ tikidub.com] | current_members = | past_members = }} '''Tiki Taane''' is a New Zealand musician and former member of leading New Zealand band [[Salmonella Dub]]. Taane left Salmonella Dub on 1 January 2007 to pursue a solo career.[http://www.muzic.net.nz/artists/2216/readpost/33505.html Tiki Taane | Artists at muzic.net.nz] His debut album, "[[Past, Present, Future (Tiki Taane album)|Past, Present, Future]]", was released on 22 October 2007 in New Zealand and has gone two times platinum, achieving a number one single, "[[Always On My Mind (Tiki Taane song)|Always On My Mind]]", which is the most successful single of all time in New Zealand. Taane is also the live sound engineer for New Zealand [[drum and bass]] act [[Shapeshifter (band)|Shapeshifter]]. ==History== In 1996, Taane was asked to become live soundman to Christchurch band Salmonella Dub, who were becoming one of NZâs most popular acts. Through this role, Tiki began to earn himself a reputation for his ability to bring a staggeringly powerful live sound to whatever equipment, venue or environment he was faced with. His time with his metal band Braaspadeak had become minuscule and irregular, and while on tour with the Dub, Tiki had composed a dub-reggae track in his hotel room. Once he shared it with Salmonella, they recorded it straight away, and Tiki and his whanau and friends set to work making a music video featuring Tiki on tour at The Gathering that year. This track, "For the Love Of It", shot to the NZ charts, and so he became faced with not only being soundman for the band, but also the public expectation that he perform his hit song at all their gigs. In both 1998 and 1999, Tiki won the Best Live Audio Engineer award at the NZ B-Net awards and though in popular demand, it was clear that Tikiâs success lay with his friends Salmonella Dub. Also winning an award for Best Song for 'For the Love Of It', Tikiâs confidence grew in his song-writing abilities and so he went on to create more hits. By 2000, Tiki was beginning to spend the majority of the Dub gigs mixing the first part of the set, then jumping on stage to perform. Taane played his final gig with Salmonella Dub on New Year's Eve 2006. Describing his decision to leave Salmonella Dub, Taane said, "I felt like I'd gone as far as I could with Salmonella Dub." He described his time since leaving Salmonella Dub as "very lonely" and "very intense".{{cite news |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/music/7704 |title=Dub king Tiki Taane goes solo |date=29 October 2007 |work=[[Stuff.co.nz]] |accessdate=22 November 2011}} Describing the band in an interview after the release of his album, Taane said, "I have so much love and respect for (Salmonella Dub) because if it wasn't for them I wouldn't be where I am now. I wouldn't be here." On April 2011, Taane was arrested on charges of "disorderly behaviour likely to cause violence to start or continue" while chanting "fuck the police" at a gig in [[Tauranga]], claiming he was singing lyrics from [[N.W.A]]'s "[[Fuck tha Police]]".{{cite web |url= http://www.3news.co.nz/Tiki-Taane-arrested-after-chanting-F-the-police-at-gig/tabid/418/articleID/206422/Default.aspx |title=Tiki Taane arrested after chanting 'F*** the police' at gig |work=3news.co.nz |year=2011 [last update] |accessdate=5 September 2011}} On his web site, Taane posted the message, "Freedom of speech is a human right"{{cite web |url= http://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10150153206912634&set=a.10150153206877634.289924.103395132633&theater |title=In The World Of ART... |work=facebook.com |year=2011 [last update] |accessdate=5 September 2011}} Tiki later stated that he "loves police" and was "not angry with them".{{cite web |url= http://entertainment.msn.co.nz/article.aspx?id=8245818 |title=Tiki Taane: face for freedom of speech? |work=entertainment.msn.co.nz |year=2011 [last update] |accessdate=5 September 2011}} On 13 April Tiki told [[Marcus Lush]] on [[Radio Live]] that the lyrics often feature in his performances and his arrest came as a complete surprise.{{cite web|url=http://www.radiolive.co.nz/Tiki-Taane---new-poster-boy-for-free-speech/tabid/506/articleID/19700/Default.aspx|title=Tiki Taane - new poster boy for freedom of speech|publisher=RadioLIVE, MediaWorks NZ|date=13 April 2011 |accessdate=2011-04-13}} Senior police stated they supported the arresting officers actions, and are confident they acted appropriately.{{cite web |url= http://tvnz.co.nz/entertainment-news/police-defend-arrest-tiki-taane-4115672 |title=Anti-police lyrics land Tiki Taane in trouble |work=tvnz.co.nz |year=2011 [last update] |accessdate=5 September 2011}} In early September, the charges against Taane were dropped after mediation; charges remain against promoter Patricio Alvarez-Riveros from the same incident.{{cite web |url= http://www.nzherald.co.nz/crime/news/article.cfm?c_id=30&objectid=10749466 |title=Thank tha police... Tiki charges dropped |work=nzherald.co.nz |year=2011 [last update] |quote= Mr Wright-St Clair said police had approached Mr Taane to seek a mediation which allowed both sides to openly express their views on how the events had unfolded. |accessdate=5 September 2011}} Taane later invited the Police to perform with him at the 2011 [[Vodafone NZ Music Awards]] at Auckland's [[Vector Arena]], where he was nominated for three awards, they declined.{{cite web |url= http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=10762592 |title=Police turn down spot at awards |work=nzherald.co.nz |year=2011 [last update] |quote=It's understood Taane last week put out an olive branch to the boys in blue. He invited police from Tauranga to join him at the Vodafone NZ Music Awards at Auckland's Vector Arena on Thursday to perform his single Freedom To Sing, a track inspired by his brush with authorities. |accessdate=30 October 2011}} ==Past, Present, Future== His debut solo record "[[Past, Present, Future (Tiki Taane album)|Past, Present, Future]]" was released 22 October 2007 and debuted at #9. The albums first official solo single, "[[Always On My Mind (Tiki Taane song)|Always On My Mind]]", was released 28 April 2008. The song has been certified 2x Platinum and made it to #1 in New Zealand, knocking [[Chris Brown (American singer)|Chris Brown]] off the top spot after a seven week reign. The song spent nineteen non-consecutive weeks in the top ten, including two weeks at number one, and a total of forty-eight weeks in the chart so far.http://charts.org.nz/showitem.asp?key=459709&cat=s "[[Always On My Mind (Tiki Taane song)|Always On My Mind]]" has also become the most successful single of all time in New Zealand, landing at number one on the Best of All Time Singles Chart, a chart that has been tracking singles since 1994. The title was previously held by "[[Bathe in the River]]" by [[Hollie Smith]].http://charts.org.nz/bestall.asp ''Past, Present, Future'' has also been certified Platinum in New Zealand and peaked at number four. The album was certified 2x Platinum after fifty-five weeks, selling over 30,000 copies. It has so far spent over sixty-six weeks in the chart. ==Music Timeline== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Year ! Activity |- | 1997 | Features on Salmonella Dub album ''[[Calming of the Drunken Monkey]]'' |- | 1999 – 2007 | Becomes a member of Salmonella Dub |- | rowspan="2"|2003 | Features on [[Rhombus (band)|Rhombus]]'s tracks "Clav Dub" and "Onward" |- | Features on [[Concord Dawn]]'s track "Don't Tell Me" |- | 2005 | Releases Dub Soldier on the ''Dub Conspiracy'' compilation |- | rowspan="2"|2006 | Features on Concord Dawn's track "Never Give Up On Love" |- | Remixes "Stay" by [[Blindspott]] |- | 2007 | Releases debut solo album ''[[Past, Present, Future (Tiki Taane album)|Past, Present, Future]]'' |- | rowspan="2"|2008 | Features on Antiform track "Got To Be You" |- | Features on Bulletproof track "Dark Times" |- | rowspan="3"|2009 | Features on [[State of Mind (band)|State of Mind]] track "Kinetic" |- | Releases remix album "Flux" |- | Remixes "Sing It To Me" by [[Knights Of The Dub Table]] |- | rowspan="3"|2010 | Features on Bulletproof track "Soundtrack To Forever" |- | Releases charity single "[[Starship Lullaby]]" |- | Releases "Summer Time" featuring DUBXL, the first single off the album [[In The World Of Light]] |- | 2011 | Releases "Light Years Away" featuring [[The Upbeats|Crushington]] |} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Name !align="left"|Album Chart !align="left"|Peak

song)|Summer Time]]" |align="center"|New Zealand Singles Chart |align="center"|28 |align="center"|- |} ==Use of music by Sea Shepherd== Before taking out his vessel ''[[Ady Gil]]'' on an anti-whaling cruise to the [[Southern Ocean]] with the [[Sea Shepherd Conservation Society]], [[Pete Bethune]] noted that he had installed a large set of speakers, and intended to play the songs like ''[[Tangaroa]]'' from Tiki Taane to the whalers, describing it as a "growling big sort of a song about the God of the Sea who looks after us".{{cite news|url= http://www.theage.com.au/national/wail-for-whales-stealth-boat-to-blast-japanese-20091130-k18l.html |title=Wail for whales: stealth boat to blast Japanese|date=29 June 2009|work=The Age|accessdate=30
